attributes.action: Use paper-based assessments for those DWP claimants who have been through abuse.
attributes.background: Abuse & Child Sexual Exploitation leaves a remaining scar on those who have been through the issue, meaning that talking about it can be extremely traumatic. It makes those who have been through CSE relive the events of that trauma, impacting not only their physical but mental health.
attributes.additional_details:
The current interview process is damaging for CSE victims. As a CSE victim I was ignored by the DWP. I was promised a Mental Health Nurse assessment and didn't see one. The general nurse didn't understand my issues. A paper-based assessment would protect victims from reliving trauma. 
Health Impacts of Child Sexual Exploitation - http://www.barnardos.org.uk/health_impacts_of_child_sexual_exploitation.pdf 

The Impact of CSE https://paceuk.info/about-cse/the-impact-of-child-sexual-exploitation/ 
Long Term Effects of CSE - https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/pdf/10.3109/01612848909140847

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for councils to have zebra crossings outside every school
attributes.background: Road Safety around children should be compulsory and precautions outside every school regardless of incidents. If there’s children crossing we need to keep them safe at all costs.
attributes.additional_details: I think that not enough is done for road safety of our children. Lollipop ladies don’t seem to exist anymore and where we are in a rural town road safety isn’t consider necessary by Kent County Council they insist on a number of incidents occurring or a fatality. It shouldn’t take something to happen for precautions to be in place. There should be a zebra crossing outside every school!

attributes.action: 6 points on the persons driving licence if caught leaving a dog in a hot car
attributes.background: People who leave their dogs in baking hot cars should be disciplined with 6 points on their driving licence and reported directly to the RSPCA.

attributes.action: Remove the VAT on purchase of defibrillators
attributes.background: Encourage the purchase of these life saving devices. Small communities are raising funds to buy these defibrillators for no reason other than to save life. Maybe yours, maybe mine, or maybe a loved one. Remove the tax and encourage the acquisition of this life saving and life changing technology

attributes.action: Include A38 Saltash to Trerulefoot dualling in 2020-25 Road Investment Strategy.
attributes.background: The single carriageway sections of A38 in SE Cornwall are not fit for purpose as a trunk road and must be upgraded to dual carriageway standard. The current road restrains economic growth, severs communities, is a poor local access road and has an accident record 2-3 times the national average.
attributes.additional_details:
This section of road has a daily flow of 23500 vehicles which is over capacity for a road of its type. Currently the road does a very poor job as both a major trunk road and a local access road. A new dual carriageway road will leave the old road to be used as a high quality local access road for buses, cyclists and local traffic. It will improve safety and resolve the toxic air quality issues at Tideford.
Please see following link for more detail:
https://www.cornwall.gov.uk/A38caseforaction

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for all UK social workers to wear body cameras
attributes.background: Service users have made allegations with no way of proving if a worker is treating them unfairly. It should be a legal requirement for social workers to wear body cameras to establish if this is the case.
attributes.additional_details: There have been cases in the headlines of children wrongfully removing from their families. There are Facebook groups of parents desperately trying to get their children home, usually without success. There are news articles and court hearings that have exposed mis-information, unfortunately children may have already been traumatised after being removed from their home, resulting in mental health issues, attachments issues and a ruined childhood.

attributes.action: Introduce hypothecated tax to support NHS by regulated distribution of cannabis.
attributes.background:
The NHS needs far more money funded from central government in order to continue to provide for everyone's physical and mental health needs in the U.K.
Evidence from some states in the US including Colorado demonstrate that legislative amendments regarding cannabis have produce substantial revenue.
attributes.additional_details:
Colorado has an geographical area similar to the United Kingdom with a population of 5 million, similar in size to Scotland. The Colorado Department of Revenue began collecting data in February 2014. In 2017 over $247 Million was raised. The total economic impact has been calculated at over $1.5 Billion.
Please refer to website link:
www.colorado.gov/pacific/revenue/colorado-marijuana-tax-data

attributes.action: Fund Carbon removal factories CDC & DAC in the UK powered by renewable energy.
attributes.background: Carbon pollution is acidifying our oceans, killing our wildlife and destroying our planet. This is unacceptable considering technology already exists that can extract Carbon from the atmosphere. Carbon Dioxide Removal (CDC) and Direct Air Capture (DAC) can catch 1 million tons of CO2 per year.
attributes.additional_details: Right now there is technology known as "Carbon Dioxide Removal (CDC)" and "Direct Air Capture (DAC)" that can remove carbon from our atmosphere. If this technology was rolled out on a national scale it will save lives, it will improve our Air. Powered by Renewable energies evidence suggests this tech could capture 1 million tons of CO2 Per Year. Recent studies show 1 in 6 deaths are linked to all forms of pollution in the UK. This is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Require sanctions for breaches of the Ministerial Code
attributes.background: Ministers breaking the ministerial code result in a report describing the breach - action may not be taken. The code should be given some force e.g. minor technical breach - an apology to Parliament: Deliberate major breach - a lifetime ban on being a Minister.
attributes.additional_details: In cases where it is found there has been a deliberate major breach, the individual, and any other who behaved similarly, could not be relied upon to abide by the code in future and would therefore be unfit to be a Minister. A right of appeal to a court should exist in the event of such a sanction.

attributes.action: Change the UK voting system to a legal requirement to increase voting turnout
attributes.background: Making voting a legal requirement will increase the turnout, making more uk citizens happier with the results. Currently, only 60% of the registered voters take part, which leaves 40% unhappy with the turnout as that have not cast a vote. We would like to change this and make voting compulsory.

attributes.action: Stop childcare providers charging parents when they are closed or have holiday.
attributes.background: This is a petition to stop parents being held to ransom by childcare providers! Currently nurseries/child minders are allowed to charge parents up to a full days rate for care when they are closed for bank holidays, staff training and xmas. Resulting in working parents taking holiday or upaid leave.

attributes.action: Introduce National Conscription with the opportunity to volunteer overeseas.
attributes.background: It seems it would be more constructive to direct school leavers at 16 or 18 to have the opportunity to be part of a group who provide the opportunity to engage in social positive role model building than to be unemployed and idle when so much help is needed across society. A better use of gov money.
attributes.additional_details: Knife crime, scooter mugging, drug taking and obesity are all escalating issues amongst young people both as perpetrators and victims. National Conscription for one year with the opporuntiy to volunteer abroad could be such a constructive initiative following the lead of Norway, Denmark and Israel - three of the happiest, most disciplined, best-educated countries in the world. Germany, France and Italy are considering something similar.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory to have lifeguards on all popular beaches in the UK
attributes.background: Too many people are dying in the sea, if there was lifeguards around there wouldn't be so many deaths.

attributes.action: Allow adoption for adults over the age of 18 like in the USA
attributes.background: Adult adoption has been legal in most states of the USA since 2002. I am now 21 years of age and at an age where I feel I can make judgement on who MY father should be. The fact that I cannot be adopted my a man who has stood by me for years because I am “too old” is completely against my rights.
attributes.additional_details: I intend on getting the law changed so that myself and others can make this descision. Many people do it for different reasons. It should be a choice that can be made at any time in an adults life.

attributes.action: Revisit the NHS Pay Deal 2018 as the initial communications were misleading
attributes.background: The detail released to NHS staff and Unions from NHS Employers was misleading and staff and unions have voted based on the information initially provided. This has resulted in large numbers of staff not receiving a 6% pay increase over 3 years as communicated.

attributes.action: Amend child maintenance rules to ensure benefits to the child
attributes.background: There are currently no CSA/DWP guidelines which govern how child maintenance payments are used by the resident parent.  Rules should be introduced to ensure child maintenance payments are used fairly & reasonably for the benefit of the child and not solely for the benefit of the resident parent.
attributes.additional_details: This principle can be achieved by allowing the non-res parent to purchase a pre-defined list of items if not provided by the res parent (e.g. school uniforms/shoes/dinner money/trips, basic clothing needs, public transport fares for travel to/from college, etc.) and to deduct the cost of such items from the amount of CM payable subject to provision of receipts. The res parent could still take action if they believed that deductions were being made unreasonably or outside the CSA/DWP guidelines.

attributes.action: The practice of unsolicited credit limit increases should be banned.
attributes.background: The Financial Conduct Authority has limited the use of unsolicited credit card limit increases, but it is not enough. There are still people actively being given these when there is no hope of them paying them off if they used them.
attributes.additional_details:
The FCA reports: "Our analysis of 2014 data showed that receiving a credit limit increase is associated with an increase in spending, with accounts that received a credit limit increase having an average balance £458 higher at the end of the year. The average credit limit increase was £1,321."

The finance industry is therefore actively encouraging people to spend more money and get further into debt. 

https://www.fca.org.uk/publication/consultation/cp17-43.pdf

attributes.action: Make the penalties for breaking election rules far stronger
attributes.background:
Vote Leave breaking electoral law in the referendum is the latest in a string of electoral scandals. 

The fines are so small as to be seen as a reasonable cost to parties and campaign groups. Penalties should include greater fines, prison and even annulment of results.

attributes.action: Introduce sanctions for Whaling nations if the hunting of Whales does not cease.
attributes.background: These countries are hunting a protected species on the pretense they're for scientific research. In reality the Whale meat is for public consumption. The three countries actually trade the meat between themselves despite an international trade ban. Whaling quotas are actually increasing.
attributes.additional_details: Feb 2018 more than 120 pregnant female whales were among 333 killed during Japan’s annual summer hunt in Antarctica. Mar 2018, Norway has announced a 28% increase of its annual whaling quota to 1,278 whales to revive the declining hunt amid international controversy. Jun 2018, Iceland’s whaling season have granted its whalers a quota of 161 fin whales in 2018, compared to 150 in 2017. Jul 2018, Icelandic Whalers kill an endangered Blue Whale...a protected species.

attributes.action: Change Abortion law to a period of 12 weeks instead of 24 weeks.
attributes.background: The Irish are proposing to introduce legislation that will restrict Category C abortions to 12 weeks, whilst we continue to allow abortions up to 24 weeks - far beyond the time when a baby can survive outside the womb.  This needs changed.
attributes.additional_details: In 2017 there were 194,668 legal abortions carried out in England & Wales (ie just over 745 abortions per working day). Of these, 98% (185,448) were carried out under category C. Of these, 99.5% were reported as being performed because of a risk to the woman’s mental health. In 13 cases, an abortion was performed under category C because of complications of pregnancy. Source - Abortion Statistics, England and Wales: 2017, Department of Health & Social Care

attributes.action: Mandatory 5 year prison sentence for carrying a knife on the first offence
attributes.background: The streets of the United Kingdom have been lost to knife wielding thugs who suffer  little or no consequence for their actions. Social media and local news is awash with videos and images of knives on our streets. The two strike rule has failed. A mandatory 5 year sentence must be enforced for all.

attributes.action: Ban Wild Animal Trophy’s entry into the UK
attributes.background: Ban Trophy Hunters bringing their murdered animals heads and skins into the UK. These creatures are being ‘hunted’ in ‘the wild’ for pleasure with considerable cruelty. The animals have no chance as the ‘hunts’ are set up by the land owners pruely for profit and the satisfaction of the most cruel.
attributes.additional_details:
A lion suffered incredible cruelty for at least 10 hours, severely wounded and slowly dying.
Clearly, although the wound was severe, the arrow had missed the vital organs or arteries that would have caused rapid blood loss and a relatively quick death.
Certainly, the lion was so incapacitated that in all those hours he'd been able to move only 350 meters from the place where he was shot.
Judging from the events described the injured lion most likely was killed 10/12 hours after being wounded.

attributes.action: Change the law to end Clearance Fee charges for imported goods.
attributes.background: When ordering items from abroad we have to face a clearance fee of up to £12 on any item we import that have VAT applied by customs. This is excessive. Consumers are being shortchanged to be delivered what is rightfully theirs.
attributes.additional_details: Parliament should legislate to end this practice.

attributes.action: Bring back the death penalty for child murderers, rapists and paedophiles.
attributes.background: The death penalty should be brought back for people who abuse and murder young babies and children or who rape babies and young children. There is no cure for pure evil or pedophillia and almost everyone who gets convicted of any of these crime almost always certainly go on to do the same again.

attributes.action: Compulsory training for all services and organisations on all Assistance Dogs
attributes.background: We would like it to be compulsory for any organisation offering a product, service (whether public or private) or recreational events or activities whether or not publicly accessible to the public to have thorough, frequent, unbiased and accurate awareness training on ALL types of assistance dogs.
attributes.additional_details:
I am a handler of an owner trained assistance dog. Luckily I have only been refused access to a service once, but I know many people have had several access issues despite it being 2019.

I am happy to help with the rollout of this training and personally help to train people and organisations myself.

attributes.action: Create hospital wards for young adults (16-21)
attributes.background: My daughter has a congenital heart defect and has been admitted to hospital many times in since turning 16 as she is no longer classed as a child patient this means she is put on adult wards which are often mixed this is uncomfortable for any young person.
attributes.additional_details: I believe that all hospitals should have wards for young people to help with the transition between child and adult services, I feel that a young person being placed on an adult ward is daunting, stressful, worrying and uncomfortable. Mixing 16-21 year olds girls with men in their 70’s, 80’s & 90’s or vice versa is not ideal! This needs to change

attributes.action: Make mental health screening mandatory for young and adult offenders.
attributes.background: For too long people going through a mental health crisis are not given the needed support which results in them being put through the criminal justice system instead. This petition is asking for a mental health report to be mandatory before an offender appears before the courts.
attributes.additional_details: According to the National Audit Office in 2016 37% of prisoners in the UK where suffering from a mental health crisis in 2016. They also stated that in the same year there was 120 self inflicted deaths, and a reported 40,161 self harm incidents reported. The cost to the tax payer is staggering and these issues are causing unprecedented pressure on our prison and police services.

attributes.action: Protect victims of domestic violence who come from the European Union
attributes.background: To date, UK immigration legislation offers protection for victims of domestic violence who hold a non-European passport. There are no easements for victims who hold a European passport, if the perpetrator was British. I believe this is in breach of art 14 ECHR, freedom from discrimination.
attributes.additional_details:
Non-EEA citizens who are victims of domestic violence can apply for indefinite leave to remain by virtue of having been a victim of domestic violence, regardless of employment status in the UK.
 
These rights do not apply to EEA nationals.  They can only qualify for settled status if they are workers, or family members of a foreign worker. This does not protect victims adequately, especially if they have been prevented from working due to coercive and controlling behaviour.

attributes.action: Allow income tax relief for home owners.
attributes.background: Currently landlords obtain Income Tax Relief on residential property financing costs.   As far as I am aware this is not available for a mortgage on somebody's home.   Please give home owners a similar type of income tax relief on their home.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/restricting-finance-cost-relief-for-individual-landlords/restricting-finance-cost-relief-for-individual-landlords

attributes.action: Make it law for alcohol producers to put all ingredients used on packaging
attributes.background: A lot of alcohol contains hidden ingredients people wouldn't think of: such as lactose and isinglass. These ingredients/processing methods may go against peoples' religious beliefs or they may be allergic to these ingredients.
attributes.additional_details: Often when emailing companies to enquire about the brewing/fermenting process or even just ingredients they will not give you a straight answer, or will tell you something whilst telling other people conflicting information. To avoid this I believe it would be simpler for companies to put ingredients and manufacturing methods on packaging or have the information freely available on websites. This would avoid any health complications due to hidden ingredients/manufacturing processes.

attributes.action: Change the law regarding organ donation so no consent required from next of kin
attributes.background: Last year my husband died. He was on the organ donor list yet they still required my consent as his next of kin to allow the donation procedure to be done. If i had declined consent they wouldn't be allowed to take his organs even though he himself had consented whilst alive. I find this very wrong
attributes.additional_details: The law currently requires that all  people on the organ donor register must have the permission of the next of kin after their death before the procedure can take place.I find this ridiculous. If you have made a choice whilst you are alive to donate your organs in the event of your death then how can it be that someone else, namely your next of kin,  can go against your wishes after your death.  This makes your choices whilst alive pretty pointless and meaningless and takes away your last wish

attributes.action: Ban all plastic straws by 2021.
attributes.background: Plastic straws are currently heavily polluting our oceans and causing significant harm to our Sea Life. A recent video released shows a sea turtle with a straw stuck in its nostril. The pain and suffering caused to creatures and the damage to the environment is unnecessary as there are alternatives.

attributes.action: Ban organised pre-election TV debates between Party Leaders
attributes.background: Pre election TV Debates between political party leaders are a distraction; they rely too heavily on personalities, not the relevant issues. ‘Accidents on the night’ can have too big an impact on election outcomes!

attributes.action: Offer free paediatric and adult first aid courses
attributes.background: Currently, first aid courses can prove quite expensive. When faced with someone in need, many don't have the confidence or knowledge to give first aid. Free courses can provide everyone with the skills and mentality, and allow them to be able to assist with first aid when needed.
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 5 people will be faced with someone who needs immediate cpr throughout their lives, yet only 39% say they are able to perform cpr. Every minute that passes increases mortality. By offering these courses It allows those who may not have the confidence, knowledge or funding to be able to intervene in situations where lives are at risk, and hopefully, make a difference.

attributes.action: Make Bonfire Night a National Holiday
attributes.background:
Between August bank holiday and Christmas there are no national holidays in the UK. This leaves millions of people with nothing to look forward to for months on end and has led to the overhyping of Christmas. 
We need another holiday to look forward to. We DESERVE another day of celebration.
attributes.additional_details:
I propose we make Bonfire Night a national holiday. The Americans and Canadians have Thanksgiving but it doesn't seem right to copy this. 
Instead let's make the quintessentially British Bonfire Night a national holiday. 
Communities can come together and make/share food. Kids doing 'penny for the guy'. We need this. 
Let's make it happen!

attributes.action: Extend the maximum length of a caravan towed by a 3.5 tonne vehicle from 7m
attributes.background: The current law stops you towing a caravan more than 7m long with anything less than 3.5 tonne vehicle when a lot of vehicles less than 3.5 tonne are capable of towing these caravans
attributes.additional_details: There seems to be more and more caravans now especially foreign caravans that are more than 7m long these can currently only be towed with a vehicle more than 3.5 tonne a lot of people still tow illegally with less than 3.5 tonne as most campsites don’t allow Comercial vehicles so this makes it hard to stay legal and still be able to enjoy using bigger family friendly caravans

attributes.action: Fund NHS continuing care for all older people.
attributes.background: Some older people are only entitled to 6 weeks free care and then they are made to pay. Care should be free for all older people.

attributes.action: Fund clinical trials in Alzheimer's based on the aldehyde toxicity hypothesis
attributes.background: There is increasing evidence to suggest Alzheimer's is caused by aldehyde toxicity. It stands to reason that medical protocol based on this hypothesis could be invaluable in the prevention and treatment of this devastating neurodegenerative condition afflicting the ageing population.
attributes.additional_details:
Public funding should be used to investigate a therapeutic cocktail of the following compounds in clinical trials to reduce the economic burden of Alzheimer's and dementia and improve quality of life in the ageing population:

N-acetylcysteine (NAC)
Niacin (nicotinic acid form)
Zinc
Molybdenum
Alpha lipoic acid
Selenium
Sulforaphane

Collectively, these compounds are integral in aldehyde detoxification and would present a powerful weapon against neurodegenerative disorders such as Alzheimer's.

attributes.action: Make it law for all restaurants to provide Braille menus.
attributes.background: Why should people not have the option to read a menu? Perhaps it's something that we sighted people take for granted. In order for visually impaired people to gain more independence, it's important that they're actually able to read a menu for themselves.

attributes.action: Require care providers and all staff to be qualified and registered
attributes.background: Care is in crisis. There are regular reports of older and vulnerable people being abused and neglected. Most carers are hard-working professionals, but to increase confidence and standards everyone in the care industry should be regulated.
attributes.additional_details: Staff at every level should be registered, increasing protection for the vulnerable but also placing carers on a professional footing. The cost of registration should be borne by providers. This register is not a criticism of hard-working care staff, and should increase their status and security, while registration of senior staff will enable them to be held accountable if they fail to provide good care.

attributes.action: Increase limit for when charities must have an independent review of accounts
attributes.background: I am involved with a charity which makes approximately £25-£30k per year, meaning we must have an independent review.  This cost us £2500 this year, which seems a disproportionately high percentage of our income.   Increasing the limit to £50k could help charities give more to the causes we support.
attributes.additional_details: According to gov.uk, there were approximately 58 thousand charities in the UK with income between £10k and £100k.  If we assume that these are evenly distributed across the range, around 16000 charities would benefit.  If their costs are similar to ours, that would be an extra £45k going to good cause each year.  While transparency is important, people give to small charities assuming the money goes to the cause they promote and 10% going to an auditor does not serve their expectations well.

attributes.action: Food labelling re sugar to simple & straight forward for all
attributes.background:
I believe all foodstuffs should just have a picture of a spoon of  sugar with a number on it denoting the amount in total in that product.
There are too many guises for sugar that consumers do not understand.

attributes.action: Give the parents of twins or multiples maternity leave per child
attributes.background: Currently the parents of twins, triplets, quads etc. Only receive one years maternity leave for one parent. We feel parents should receive maternity leave per child.

attributes.action: Ban Online Casinos
attributes.background: Online casinos cause misery for the user and their families and friends.This is an addictive gambling machine and not a fun way to waste peoples money. Ban all online and shop based slot machines.

attributes.action: Make it unlawful for social/news outlets to host any material of any child abuse
attributes.background: Failing to censor this material on platforms that are at so many peoples’ fingertips normalises this behaviour and perpetuates child abuse. Social and news medias have a responsibility to protect the vulnerable. These platforms must stop putting revenue before child safety by reporting and censoring
attributes.additional_details: Recent channel 4 Dispatches found that Facebook's moderators were not removing child physical abuse images from its platform, they merely place a warning on the images. Similarly, the mail online recently showed a graphic video of a mother beating her twins for profit. It is my belief that by leaving this kind of footage on media, whereby you needn’t seek it out, desensitises the public, normalises this behaviour and justifies mimicking. Any abuse of children should be taken as seriously as sex abuse

attributes.action: Extend paternity leave to at least 4 weeks so fathers can bond with their child.
attributes.background: Being a father and being there for your new born baby is so important at the early stages of life, to bond and make that connect this needs to happen early on in a baby's life, also helping your partner out with the night and day duties taking some of that pressure off the mother.
attributes.additional_details: How can men and women truly be treated equally if the father only get 1-2 week paternity leave and the mother gets up 26 weeks with full pay and 26 weeks additional weeks half pay depending on the company. This is such a serious matter and should be looked into carefully in the best interest of the baby and parents no matter the sex.

attributes.action: law to put panic buttons in hgv s incase drivers have medical emergency
attributes.background: Lots of drivers going missing and when found are deceased in their cabs, either unable to raise alarm of feeling unwell or no signal on phone etc

attributes.action: Alll people charged with a sexual offence against children remanded in custody.
attributes.background: Children are our future. The most valuable people in society. If the CPS deems enough evidence to charge offenders exist, that means they are a danger to all children. Which means they should be on remand until their court case. No bail can circumvent this risk. No prison spaces? Build new prisons.

attributes.action: Increase Child Benefit to £40 per child per week
attributes.background: There are 4.1 Million children in poverty in the UK. And another new 753 children fall in to poverty each day. The best way to tackle it is by increasing child benefits, so this will not prevent people from getting in to work, getting better jobs or better salaries as there is no taper rate for CB.
attributes.additional_details:
67% of children in poverty are from working families. https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/education-39291999
http://www.cpag.org.uk/content/child-poverty-facts-and-figures

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poverty_in_the_United_Kingdom#Poverty_in_the_UK_in_the_21st_century

https://www.google.co.uk/search?ei=m9U8W8DoGYuvgQb-6Z_IAg&q=how+to+end+poverty+in+uk+by+increasing+child+benefit+to+%C2%A340+per+week&oq=how+to+end+poverty+in+uk+by+increasing+child+benefit+to+%C2%A340+per+week&gs_l=psy-ab.3...10100.19683.0.20219.16.16.0.0.0.0.96.903.16.16.0....0...1c.1.64.psy-ab..0.4.241...33i160k1.0.mWs7Ge3vIsw&safe=active&ssui=on

attributes.action: Keep Domesticated Animals in Travelling Circuses
attributes.background: Domesticated Animals in Travelling Circuses are only allowed by certain Councils at the moment. Because you mention a Circus has Animals in it certain Councils want to Ban them i hope my Petition will stop this from happening and let this tradition continue
attributes.additional_details: Domesticated Animals in Travelling Circuses could range from Dogs, Cats to Budgies and Horses that come from Outside the UK that forms part of a Travelling Circuses Act and will only be allowed if the Animals coming into the UK have been Inspected by the RSPCA/SSPCA etc and only then will Horses from outside be allowed in Travelling Circuses.
